column5: The Local Government Act 1985 is an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.

column4: The Local Government Act 1985 was an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.
column5: Its main effect was to abolish the six county councils of the metropolitan counties that had been set up in 1974, 11 years earlier, by the Local Government Act 1972, along with the Greater London Council that had been established in 1965.

column4: The Local Government Act 1985 was an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.
column5: In their place many single purpose authorities known collectively as 'joint authorities' were established for fire service, police and passenger transport.

column4: The Local Government Act 1985 was an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.
column5: An ad hoc education authority was established for Inner London and a planning authority for Greater London.

column4: The Local Government Act 1985 was an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.
column5: The legislation permitted councils to form 'joint arrangements' for waste disposal and other services that they wished to provide together.
